name: Aspartame
desc: Aspartame is a chemical compound that belongs to the peptide ester group. Itâ€™s a flavoring agent, sweeter than sugar, converted to phenylalanine and aspartic acid.
techs: Aspartame is a dipeptide obtained by formal condensation of the alpha-carboxy group of L-aspartic acid with the amino group of methyl L-phenylalaninate. It comes in a form of white or nearly white crystalline powder.
shelf: The shelf life of Aspartame is up to 6 months.
packaging: Foodcom supplies its Business Partners with Aspartame in 25 kg bags.
applications: Aspartame is often used as a sweetener, with code E951. Added to food, it compensates for the lack of sugar or fat. Therefore, it is a product mainly used by diabetics. The list of products that have this sweetener in them include certain yogurts, sweetened sodas, flavored mineral waters, isotonic drinks, and more.
